perturbation.original_text: 1.1 iBio hereby grants to CC-Pharming for the term of this Agreement, a nonexclusive, non- assignable, non-sublicensable, limited right and license to use iBio's Technology in order to manufacture, process, prepare, and obtain regulatory approval for the development and production of Product(s) and work to be performed under this Agreement. Each Product will be set forth in a separate Statement of Work in the form set forth in Appendix A, which will be signed by representatives of each Party with signing authority.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1 iBio hereby grants to CC-Pharming a nonexclusive, non- assignable, non-sublicensable, limited right and license to use iBio's Technology solely for research purposes. Manufacturing, processing, or preparing any products using iBio's technology is strictly prohibited under this section of the agreement, and any attempts to do so will be considered a breach of this Agreement. Each Product will be set forth in a separate Statement of Work in the form set forth in Appendix A, which will be signed by representatives of each Party with signing authority.
perturbation.explanation: The original text grants rights for manufacturing, processing, preparing, and obtaining regulatory approval. The modified text contradicts this by only allowing use for research and explicitly prohibiting manufacturing and related activities, creating uncertainty regarding the scope of the license.

perturbation.original_text: 7.3 Each of the parties agrees that for five (5) years from the date of disclosure, the receiving Party agrees to limit disclosure of the disclosing Party's Confidential Information to those of the receiving party's employees and contractors, and employees and contractors of its Subsidiaries, who have a need to know it, and the receiving Party agrees to use the same care and discretion to avoid disclosure, publication or dissemination outside of those employees and contractors as the receiving Party does with similar information of its own which it does not desire to publish, disclose or disseminate.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.3 Each of the parties agrees that disclosure of the disclosing Party's Confidential Information is permitted to the receiving party's employees and contractors, and employees and contractors of its Subsidiaries, provided the receiving party uses reasonable efforts to limit dissemination outside of those individuals. There is no restriction on how long this agreement stays in place.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a strict 5-year limit and requires the receiving party to use the same level of care as they would for their own confidential information. The modified text removes the time limit and weakens the standard of care, creating an ambiguity about the duration and required level of protection for Confidential Information. The original is for 5 years. the new section is indefinite.

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Attorney's Fees. In the event that any claim, suit, action or proceeding is instituted or commenced by any Party hereto against any other Party arising out of or related to this Agreement, the prevailing Party will be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees, expert fees, expenses and court costs from the non-prevailing Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Attorney's Fees. In the event that any claim, suit, action or proceeding is instituted or commenced by any Party hereto against any other Party arising out of or related to this Agreement, each party shall bear its own attorney's fees, expert fees, expenses and court costs, regardless of the outcome of the claim, suit, action, or proceeding. However, if the claim is frivolous, the prevailing party may be entitled to reasonable attorney's fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that the prevailing party recovers attorney's fees. The modified text initially states that each party bears their own costs, but then introduces an exception for frivolous claims, creating an ambiguity about when attorney's fees can be recovered. The second condition creates uncertainty for the user.
